results.title: Grampa's monster movies
results.creator_credit: Bertram Siegelson, Amvest Video and Peter Zasuly
results.brief_description: Grampa Munster leads the viewer through an exploration of classic monster movie trailers. Trailers featured include: House of Frankenstein (1944), House of Dracula (1945), Son of Dracula (1943), Dracula’s daughter (1936), Dracula (1931), The Invisible man returns (1940), The Invisible woman (1940), Invisible agent (1942), The Invisible ray (1936), Frankenstein (1931), Frankenstein meets the Wolf Man (1943), Bride of Frankenstein (1935), The ghost of Frankenstein (1942), Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein (1948), Phantom of the opera (1943), The Climax (19??), The Werewolf of London (1935), The Mystery of Marie Roget (1942), Murders in the Rue Morgue (1932), Flesh and fantasy (1943), The Wolfman (1941), The Mummy (1932), The Mummy’s hand (1940), The Mummy’s curse (1944), The Black cat (1934), The Cat creeps (1946), Black Friday (1940), and Horror island (1941).

results.title: Grain structure
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Robin Cantelon and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
Explains how grain structure and grain size in steel are affected by its carbon content the way in which it is worked and its heat treatment. Indicates also how properties of hardness, ductility and tensile strength are due to differences in its internal structure.

results.title: Grain elevator
results.creator_credit: Wayne Finucan Productions and Charles Konawal
results.brief_description: Basic film about the workings of an old family style grain mill, a one to two man operation. One hundred and fifty box cars per year of grain are provided from about 100 small farmers.

results.title: Graham Sutherland
results.creator_credit: John Elliot, BBC-TV and John Read
results.brief_description: A films about distinguished English painter best known for his portraits of Somerset Maugham, Lord Beaverbrook and Sir Winston Churchill. Sutherland is, however, a landscape artist who treats his subjects in a highly personal and poetic manner, which goes beyond surface realism. Descriptive sequences were specially shot in Pembrokeshire and in the South of France to show landscapes which have influenced his painting. The film concludes with a personal statement by the artist about his approach to his work.

results.title: Graeme Bell
results.creator_credit: Sharon Connolly, Frank Heimans and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian biography”.
Often described as the ‘father of Australian jazz’ Graeme Bell has had a sixty year love affair with music, both as a performer and a composer. Discover the story of his life, speak to the man about his passion, and hear his wonderful music.

results.title: Graduated guidance and backward chaining (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 3 : Graduated guidance and backward chaining are procedures that can be used to help retarded students master new behaviours or responses. To understand these procedures the film looks first at response chains, a sequence of stimuli and responses that end with a terminal reinforcer. NB. This tape is on 525 line NTSC.

results.title: Graduate harvest
results.brief_description: Massey College, situated in Palmerston North, is an agricultural college attached to the university of New Zealand. Students, including many from other parts of the world, attend coursers in horticulture, fruit growing, cheese and butter making, dairying and the raising of sheep and pigs.

results.title: Grace Tame’s address to the National Press Club
results.brief_description: When Australian of the Year Grace Tame, an activist and advocate for survivors of sexual assault, was asked what she thought of Prime Minister Scott Morrison’s response ‘as a father’ to rape allegations made by Brittany Higgins, Tame did not mince her words. Herself a survivor of child sexual abuse and influential in the Let Her Speak Campaign, Tame used the National Press Club address to call on fellow survivors, saying “Share your truth, it is your power. One voice, your voice, and our collective voices can make a difference”.
results.title_for_label: Grace Tame’s address to the National Press Club
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

When Australian of the Year Grace Tame, an activist and advocate for survivors of sexual assault, was asked what she thought of Prime Minister Scott Morrison’s response ‘as a father’ to rape allegations made by Brittany Higgins, Tame did not mince her words. Herself a survivor of child sexual abuse and influential in the Let Her Speak Campaign, Tame used the National Press Club address to call on fellow survivors, saying “Share your truth, it is your power. One voice, your voice, and our collective voices can make a difference”.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

When Australian of the Year Grace Tame, an activist and advocate for survivors of sexual assault, was asked what she thought of Prime Minister Scott Morrison’s response ‘as a father’ to rape allegations made by Brittany Higgins, Tame did not mince her words. Herself a survivor of child sexual abuse and influential in the Let Her Speak Campaign, Tame used the National Press Club address to call on fellow survivors, saying “Share your truth, it is your power. One voice, your voice, and our collective voices can make a difference”.
